page.title: 14The Local School
page.content: There is a small two teacher Rural School at Johnstonebridge which has 26 pupils at present. The school opened in 1873, a new classroom, inside toilets and a staff room were added about 16 years ago. The lunches are cooked on the premises by the school cook as the school has its own kitchen and dining room built about 20 years ago. Twenty-five of the twenty six children stay for lunch. This is a great asset socially as most of the children come from fairly isolated farms and enjoy the chance of eating and playing together. The school holds a Christmas Concert each year and an End of Term Ceremony, always well attended by parents. The Christmas and Hallowe'en Parties as well as a Burns' Supper are annual events in the school.
